info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 4:28PM EDT until June 26 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Nelson County in central Virginia... Southeastern Augusta County in western Virginia... The southern City of Staunton in western Virginia... The western City of Waynesboro in western Virginia... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 428 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stuarts Draft, or 9 miles southwest of Staunton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Staunton, Waynesboro, Stuarts Draft, Sherando, Fishersville, Verona, Lyndhurst, Greenville, Middlebrook, Mint Spring, Afton Mountain and Hermitage. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
